results.title: Concorde
results.brief_description: Concerned with the background to Concorde, in particular some of the problems which occurred when designing and building an airliner for supersonic flight. Covers various aspects of the problem including: pioneering problems, airframe stresses, design, temperature problem, structure and assembly. Contains some animated sequences. Narrated by Nick Reid.
results.description: Concerned with the background to Concorde, in particular some of the problems which occurred when designing and building an airliner for supersonic flight. results.title: Concerto grosso modo
results.creator_credit: Yves Leduc, ONF | NFB and Francois Aubry
results.brief_description: An animated film about the magic of music. A group of musicians plays on stage. Suddenly, the audience is drawn through a cello into a mysterious world where musical notes assume human qualities. They discover how music is made. A combination of live action and cel animation emphasizes the transition from reality to fantasy. The film works as entertainment and as a teaching tool for children and adults. Film without words.

results.title: Concerto for orchestra
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Robert Parker
results.brief_description: The life and work of members of the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and its resident conductor, Dean Dixon, the off-duty hobbies and pastimes of members of the orchestra, ranging from surf fishing and motor racing to violin making and chess. Highlight is an invitation by the conductor to kindergarten children to play the instrument of their choice. Features music of Bela Bartok.

results.title: Concerto for ads and heads
results.brief_description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.
results.description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.

results.title: Concepts, memories & catagories
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the cognitive changes occuring in children between 5 & 7 years. Reviews research on conceptual and memory development, logical reasoning and problem solving. Observes a Japanese child assuming family responsibilities, Russian children joining the Young Pioneers and Brazilian children participating in church rituals.
